title: What is kill Aura and why is it banable ?

replies.body: Killaura is a type of hack which lets you hit the player closest to you
replies.body_tagged: Killaura is a type of hack which lets you hit the player closest to you

replies.body: It's basically a hack that lets you hit anyone around you in a certain radius automatically, with your head appearing to spin around while not actually doing so in first-person point of view. It's bannable, because it gives you a severe advantage over others.
replies.body_tagged: It's basically a hack that lets you hit anyone around you in a certain radius automatically, with your head appearing to spin around while not actually doing so in first-person point of view. It's bannable, because it gives you a severe advantage over others.

replies.body: I want to see proof of one player doing this.
replies.body_tagged: I want to see proof of one player doing this.

reply_to.body: I want to see proof of one player doing this.
reply_to.body_tagged: I want to see proof of one player doing this.

replies.body_tagged: I ment a player that just did it today

replies.body: We can't give out recordings of hackers; doing so would embarrass the player greatly.
replies.body_tagged: We can't give out recordings of hackers; doing so would embarrass the player greatly.

replies.body:
I see a problem. But first let me answer your question.  Kill aura is technically forcefield which let's you hit players in a radius around you, even if you don't hit them. 

And I am so curious why you want a banned player's hacking proof. And how do you know this player cares or not? Sorry we can't give out recordings. If you're curious what kill aura looks like, please go on YouTube.
replies.body_tagged:
I see a problem. But first let me answer your question.  Kill aura is technically forcefield which let's you hit players in a radius around you, even if you don't hit them. 

And I am so curious why you want a banned player's hacking proof. And how do you know this player cares or not? Sorry we can't give out recordings. If you're curious what kill aura looks like, please go on YouTube.
